result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony A Alvarez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony A Alvarez not in court.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court for Anthony A Alvarez.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. For reasons stated on the record, defendant is not present. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Court adjourns matter for a status conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Anthony A Alvarez in court in person with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 11, Judge Swanson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 11.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No driving without a valid license.  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony A Alvarez in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Anthony A Alvarez in custody at Children's Detention Center.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony A Alvarez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Anthony A Alvarez not in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/24/2022@1:00p
